com.ibm.team.process.client

Interface IClientProcess


  • public interface IClientProcess
    Representation of the team process on the client. The team process is inherently associated with a project area.

    This interface is not intended to be implemented by clients.

    Since:
    0.5

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getProjectArea

        IProjectArea getProjectArea()
        Returns the project area this process is governing.
        Returns:
        the project area this process is governing

      • getRoles

        IRole[] getRoles(IProcessArea processArea,
               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the collection of roles which are available to the given process area. This collection consists of any roles defined in the given area as well as any roles defined in parent areas.
        Parameters:
        processArea - the process area
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the collection of roles which are available to the given process area
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

      • getContributorRoles

        IRole[] getContributorRoles(IContributorHandle contributor,
                          IProcessArea processArea,
                          org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                            throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the roles assigned to the given contributor relative to the given process area.
        Parameters:
        contributor - the contributor
        processArea - the process area
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the roles assigned to the contributor
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

      • getProjectConfigurationData

        IProcessConfigurationData getProjectConfigurationData(java.lang.String configDataId,
                                                    org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the project configuration data for the configuration point with the given id. The configuration data look up is confined to the project area.
        Parameters:
        configDataId - the id of the configuration data configuration point
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the configuration matching the given id or null if there is no such configuration data available
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled

      • getAdvisorDeclarations

        IAdvisorDeclaration[] getAdvisorDeclarations(IProcessArea processArea,
                                           java.lang.String operationId,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the collection of advisors declarations which are configured for the given operation relative to the given process area. The returned advisor declarations correspond to the advisors which would be run if an operation with the given id and process area were advised by this process.

        Note that this method only works for team operations. For project operations, use getAdvisorDeclarations(String, IProgressMonitor) instead.

        Parameters:
        processArea - the starting process area
        operationId - the operation id
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the advisor declarations which are configured for the given operation relative to the given area
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • getAdvisorDeclarations

        IAdvisorDeclaration[] getAdvisorDeclarations(java.lang.String projectOperationId,
                                           org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                             throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the collection of advisors declarations which are configured for the given project operation. The returned advisor declarations correspond to the advisors which would be run if a project operation with the given id were advised by this process.

        Note that this method only works for project operations. For team operations, use getAdvisorDeclarations(IProcessArea, String, IProgressMonitor) instead.

        Parameters:
        projectOperationId - the project operation id
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the advisor declarations which are configured for the given project operation
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • getPermittedActions

        boolean[] getPermittedActions(IProcessArea processArea,
                            java.lang.String operationId,
                            java.lang.String[] actions,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Queries whether the current user has permissions to perform each of the given actions relative to the given process area. Each entry in the returned array specifies whether the user has permissions for the corresponding action in the given array.

        Note that this method only works for team operations. For project operations, use getPermittedActions(String, String[], IProgressMonitor) instead.

        Parameters:
        processArea - the process area
        operationId - the identifier of the operation
        actions - the collection of actions to consider
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        an array of booleans which specifies whether each of the given actions are permitted
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • getPermittedActions

        boolean[] getPermittedActions(java.lang.String projectOperationId,
                            java.lang.String[] actions,
                            org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                              throws TeamRepositoryException
        Queries whether the current user has permissions to perform each of the given actions for the given project operation. Each entry in the returned array specifies whether the user has permissions for the corresponding action in the given array.

        Note that this method only works for team operations. For project operations, use getPermittedActions(IProcessArea, String, String[], IProgressMonitor) instead.

        Parameters:
        projectOperationId - the identifier of the project operation
        actions - the collection of actions to consider
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        an array of booleans which specifies whether each of the given actions are permitted
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • advise

        IOperationReport advise(AdvisableOperation operation,
                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Computes advice for the given operation. This method does not execute the operation; it only computes whether the operation's preconditions have been satisfied.
        Parameters:
        operation - the operation
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the advice computed for the given operation
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs computing advice for the given operation. Also, any team repository exceptions thrown by the given runnable are rethrown by this method
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the operation is incomplete or associated with a process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
        java.lang.RuntimeException - any runtime exceptions thrown by the given operation are rethrown by this method

      • adviseAndExecute

        IOperationReport adviseAndExecute(AdvisableOperation operation,
                                org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Computes advice for the given operation. Based on the advice, the operation may then be executed.

        This method must only be called once for a given operation. Subsequent attempts to execute the same operation should use reAdviseAndExecute(AdvisableOperation, IOperationReport, IProgressMonitor) instead.

        Parameters:
        operation - the operation
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the advice computed for the given operation
        Throws:
        TeamOperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled by process. Reasons may include missing permissions and unsatisfied preconditions.
        StaleConfigurationDataException - if stale configuration data was used to advise the operation
        TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs computing advice for the given operation. Also, any team repository exceptions thrown by the given runnable are rethrown by this method
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the operation is incomplete or associated with a process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
        java.lang.RuntimeException - any runtime exceptions thrown by the given operation are rethrown by this method

      • reAdviseAndExecute

        IOperationReport reAdviseAndExecute(AdvisableOperation operation,
                                  IOperationReport report,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Computes advice for the given operation. Based on the advice, the operation may then be executed.

        This method should only be called for an operation which has previously attempted to execute. First attempts at executing operations should use adviseAndExecute(AdvisableOperation, IProgressMonitor) instead. This method may be called multiple times for a given operation.

        Parameters:
        operation - the operation
        report - the report containing the advice which was computed the last time an attempt was made to run this operation
        monitor - the progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the advice computed for the given operation
        Throws:
        TeamOperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled by process. Reasons may include missing permissions and unsatisfied preconditions.
        StaleConfigurationDataException - if stale configuration data was used to advise the operation
        TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs computing advice for the given operation. Also, any team repository exceptions thrown by the given runnable are rethrown by this method
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the operation is incomplete or associated with a process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
        java.lang.RuntimeException - any runtime exceptions thrown by the given operation are rethrown by this method

      • executeInitializer

        IOperationReport executeInitializer(ProjectOperation initializer,
                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                    throws TeamRepositoryException
        Executes the given initializer and afterwards executes all configured participants. This method should only be called once for a given initializer.

        The given initializer is responsible for initializing a project area. At a minimum, this means that after the initializer is executed, IProjectArea.isInitialized() must return true.

        Note that process permissions are not enforced when an initializer and its participants are executed. Initialization is protected only by repository permissions.

        Parameters:
        initializer - the initializer
        monitor - a progress monitor or null
        Returns:
        the operation report computed for the given initializer or null
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if an error occurs computing advice for the given operation. Also, any team repository exceptions thrown by the given initializer are rethrown by this method
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the operation is incomplete or associated with a process area not covered by this process
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - in case this operation has been canceled
        java.lang.RuntimeException - any runtime exceptions thrown by the given operation are rethrown by this method

      • getProcessAttachment

        IProcessAttachment getProcessAttachment(IProcessArea processArea,
                                      java.lang.String attachmentPath,
                                      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                        throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the handle to the process attachment with the given path associated with the given process area. If the given process area is a project area that uses an enterprise process as the source of its process, this method will find attachments on the enterprise process.
        Parameters:
        processArea - the process area
        attachmentPath - path for the attachment on the processArea.
        Returns:
        handle to the attachment, or null if no attachment with the given path is found.
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - in case this operation fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given process area not covered by this process

      • getProcessAttachments

        IProcessAttachment[] getProcessAttachments(IProcessArea processArea,
                                         org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                           throws TeamRepositoryException
        Get all process attachments for a process area. If the process area is a project area that consumes process, get the attachments from the provider in addition to the attachments on the consumer. If an attachment on the consumer has the same path as one on the provider, only the attachment from the consumer is returned.
        Parameters:
        processArea - the project area
        monitor - IProgressMonitor
        Returns:
        attachments from the process area, including attachments from the provider if applicable
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException - if there is a problem communicating with the repository.
